Message:
I burst into the grand hall,
where my father looked
at me with cold eyes.

“Carmilla. I heard you skipped
out on your studies again.

One day, you’ll lead this clan.
You need to—”

“Now’s not the time
to worry about that!
There’s an inquisitor
in the village!
They’ve figured out
what we are!”

I desperately pointed
out the window.
Under the cover of night,
countless flames were
moving through the forest,
making their way
toward the castle.
And yet, my father didn’t budge.

“We’ve paid off
the Church many times.
This little investigation’s
all just for show.
There’s no need to worry.”

Father didn’t understand.
He hadn’t seen
the rabid mobs of villagers.

That frenzy couldn’t be
stopped with any more bribes.
